lead_paragraph: William Scarborough, a New York assemblyman from Queens, plans to plead guilty next week to federal charges accusing him of stealing about $40,000 from the state.

headline.main: Assemblyman Scarborough to Step Down and Plead Guilty to Corruption Charges

snippet: William Scarborough, a New York assemblyman from Queens, plans to plead guilty next week to federal charges accusing him of stealing about $40,000 from the state.
abstract: New York State Assemblyman William Scarborough of Queens will resign his seat after admitting to falsifying travel records in order to pad his salary with per diem payments; is scheduled to change plea to guilty on two felony charges; ethics measures in latest state budget include new controls on travel expenses.
